relationships.notes: Receives appointment from Jesus among the Twelve after the night of prayer, sharing the mandate to be with him and be sent out.
Repeatedly paired with Philip in apostolic lists, signaling a collaborative missionary partnership.
Prays with Peter and the Jerusalem apostles in the upper room after the ascension, remaining part of the leadership core awaiting the Spirit.

traits.role_among_twelve: Appears in the list of the Twelve as one of Jesus’s appointed apostles.
traits.narrative_profile: Receives no individual stories or dialogue in Mark, functioning primarily as a name in the authoritative roster of witnesses.

traits.listing_in_mission_discourse: Named among the Twelve whom Jesus commissions and sends out with authority over unclean spirits and disease.
traits.lack_of_individualization: Like several other apostles, is not given distinct episodes or sayings in Matthew beyond the list itself.

traits.selection_as_apostle: Named in Luke’s list of those whom Jesus designates apostles after a night of prayer.
traits.presence_in_post_easter_community: Appears in the list of those gathered in the upper room in Jerusalem after the ascension, waiting for the promised Spirit.
traits.narrative_silence: Receives no further individual characterization, remaining part of the collective apostolic foundation.
traits.identification_with_nathanael_tradition: Later Christian interpretation often associates Bartholomew with Nathanael in John’s Gospel, though the texts themselves do not make this identification explicit.
